From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

On 12 July 2016 at 14:32, hagg.a@... [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
> one of our bachelor's student is currently working on a Matlab implementation, including
> evolution of activation functions. I was wondering whether anything has been published
> as I was not able to find anything, except for python-NEAT, which is an implementation
> but without publication, as far as I can see it.


Further to Pablo's previous comments; SharpNEAT also supports use of
radial basis function (RBF) nodes, which are nodes with a
parameterised activation function where each node evolves its own
parameters. The RBF function is one specific 'flavour' of activation
function that happens to be parameterised, but it should be relatively
straightforward to switch to a different parameterised activation
function.

Colin
